title: Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered Gets Two More Suits

paragraphs: Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered, the next-gen re-release of the acclaimed 2018 title, has two more Spidey suits swinging its way. The remaster already sports several updates including the addition of Andrew Garfield’s suit from The Amazing Spider-Man film and a controversial redesign for Peter Parker.

Feast your eyes on the Arachnid Rider (above) and Armored Advanced suits (below). Before any comic fans rack their brains recalling which stories the outfits come from, Insomniac confirmed they are original creations and will be unlockable in-game. The studio also states that the remaster’s three new suits will also come to the PS4 version of the game, though at an undetermined date.

You can never have too many Spidey outfits, and these look as good as anything else. The Arachnid Rider’s cel-shaded, anime-esque style is especially unique. Although, the Armored Advanced suit looks slick in how striking it is. As a Spider-Man nerd, let’s just say I am okay with everything that is happening here.

Marvel’s Spider-Man Remastered takes advantage of the PlayStation 5’s power with faster load times, improved visuals, 3D spatial audio, and haptic feedback via the DualSense controller. It also includes all 3 chapters of The City That Never Sleeps DLC. The game launches November 12 as a pack-in with the $69.99 Ultimate Edition of Spider-Man: Miles Morales. Unfortunately, the remaster will not be sold separately nor as a next-gen upgrade for owners of the PS4 version.
For more wall-crawling goodness, check out our review of Spider-Man: Miles Morales. With the PlayStation 5 launching next week, be sure to also check out our full review of Sony's upcoming console.
What do you think of these spiffy new suits? Let us know in the comments!
